content:
I think in settings we want to be very clear that there's stuff under the fold, and also there's no restriction on horizontal space. Should we replace the perfect scrollbar with the browser scrollbar?

At minimum, I think we need an "always on" scrollbar, since now you could easily look at some of our settings pages and not realize there was stuff under the fold.
@Rishi Gupta I'm pretty sure there's just an option for "make scrollbar visible" we could use without changing the infrastructure.
(In general we want to avoid browser scrollbars for almost everything, because they take up different amounts of space on different platforms, which leads to platform-specific CSS bugs)

Apparently the way to fix this is with CSS:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40548772/make-perfect-scrollbar-visible-by-default
and making it wider as well: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34139635/how-to-customize-perfect-scrollbar-width
